unitsTotal.description: All unit sales on the Steam platform

revenueTotal.description: Gross revenue from games sold in USD

releasesTotal.description: Number of games released on Steam

usersOnline.description: Highest number of Steam users online, but not necessarily in-game in a given time period

usersIngame.description: Highest number of Steam users in-game in a given time period

accountsTotal.description: Number of registered accounts on Steam

date.description: Requested date in ISO 8601 format. E.g. 2015-12-31

positiveReviewsChange.description: Change in positive reviews on a given date

negativeReviewsChange.description: Change in negative reviews on a given date

positiveReviewsTotal.description: Total positive reviews on a given date

negativeReviewsTotal.description: Total negative reviews on a given date

avgPlaytime.description: Average lifetime playtime across all users for the game. In minutes.

medianPlaytime.description: Median lifetime playtime across all users for the game. In minutes.

steamAppId.description:
ID of the reference game.
Player Overlap shows how many players of the main game X also play the reference game Y.

medianPlaytime.description: Shows how many hours of the main game a typical player of a reference game has played.

unitsSoldOverlap.description: Absolute number of people who own both the main game and the reference game.

unitsSoldOverlapPercentage.description: Percentage of main game owners who also play the reference game.

unitsSoldOverlapIndex.description:
How much more likely are main game owners to also own the reference game VS a typical Steam user.
E.g. 0.5 would be half as likely and 2.0 would be twice as likely.

mauOverlap.description: Absolute number of people who play both games

mauOverlapPercentage.description: Percentage of main game's Monthly Active Users who also play the reference game.

mauOverlapIndex.description: How much more likely are main game's Monthly Active Users to also play the reference game VS a typical Steam user.

wishlistOverlap.description: Absolute number of people who have wishlisted the main game who also own the reference game.

wishlistOverlapPercentage.description: Percentage of main game's wishlisters who also own the reference game.

wishlistOverlapIndex.description: How much more likely are main game's wishlisters to also own the reference game VS a typical Steam user.

steamAppId.description:
ID of the main game.
Player Overlap shows how many players of the main game X also play the reference game Y.

companyId.description: VGI's internal ID for companies. If developer and publisher have the same ID, then it is the same company.

vgiUrl.description: Link to the company's page on the Video Game Insights platform

price.description: The current USD price of the game

releaseDate.description: Release date in ISO 8601 format. E.g. 2015-12-31

fullReleaseDate.description: Full release date in ISO 8601 format. E.g. 2016-12-31

genres.description: Comma separated list of genre names

subgenres.description: Comma separated list of subgenre names

languages.description: Comma separated list of supported languages

vgiUrl.description: Link to the game's page on the Video Game Insights platform

steamUrl.description: Link to the game's Steam store page. If game has been removed, the link redirects to the store's home page.

date.description: Date when the value was recorded

get.description: This endpoint returns the list of all Steam games in VGI's database. The list contains ID and name of each game. ID is the Steam app ID.
get.summary: The full list of all available Steam games.

get.description: This endpoint returns the rankings of a Steam game. The rankings are based on the number of reviews, sales data, game followers and playtime insights.
get.summary: Rankings of a Steam game

200.description: An array of game objects containing the Steam app ID of the game and rankings such as positive reviews, total revenue, total units sold, and more.

get.description: This endpoint returns the rankings of multiple Steam games. The rankings are based on the number of reviews, sales data, game followers and playtime insights.
get.summary: Rankings of Steam games

parameters.description: (Optional) The number of records to skip for pagination
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: (Optional) The maximum number of records to return. Without specifying limit you will receive 5 results. The maximum limit is 1000.
parameters.name: limit

get.description:
This endpoint returns the list of all Steam developers in VGI's database. The list contains ID and name of each developer.
ID is an internal VGI's ID for the developer. If the ID matches with a publisher, then this means that it is the same company.
get.summary: The full list of all available Steam developers.

200.description: An array of developers' overview objects, including the company ID, name, information about the developed games and developers' revenue insights.

get.description: This endpoint returns the overview of all game developers. The overview contains the company ID, name, information about the developed games and developers' revenue insights.
get.summary: Overview of games developer companies.

parameters.description: (Optional) The number of records to skip for pagination
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: (Optional) The maximum number of records to return. Without specifying limit you will receive 5 results. The maximum limit is 1000.
parameters.name: limit

200.description: An array of Steam app IDs of all games that the companies have developed.

get.description: This endpoint returns the list of Steam app IDs of all games that developer companies have developed. Unlike the endpoint retrieving the Steam app IDs of a single developer company, this one returns the list of games for multiple developers.
get.summary: The list of Steam app IDs of all games that the companies have developed.

parameters.description: (Optional) The number of records to skip for pagination
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: (Optional) The maximum number of records to return. Without specifying limit you will receive 5 results.
parameters.name: limit

get.description: This endpoint returns the overview of a games developer. The overview contains the company ID, name, information about the developed games and developer revenue insights.
get.summary: Overview of a games developer.

parameters.description: The company ID of the developer. This is an internal VGI's ID for the developer. If the ID matches with a publisher, then this means that it is the same company.
parameters.name: companyId

get.description: This endpoint returns the list of Steam app IDs of all games that the company/developer has developed.
get.summary: Get the list of Steam app IDs of all games that the company has developed.

parameters.description: The company ID of the developer. This is an internal VGI's ID for the developer. If the ID matches with a publisher, then this means that it is the same company.
parameters.name: companyId

get.description:
This endpoint returns the list of all Steam publishers in VGI's database. The list contains the company ID and the company name.
ID is an internal VGI's ID for the publisher. If the ID matches with a developer, then this means that it is the same company.
get.summary: The full list of all available Steam publishers.

200.description: An array of publishers' overview objects, including the company ID, name, information about the published games and publishers' revenue insights.

get.description: This endpoint returns the overview of publisher companies. The overview contains the company ID, name, information about the published games and publishers' revenue insights.
get.summary: Overview of games' publishers.

parameters.description: (Optional) The number of records to skip for pagination
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: (Optional) The maximum number of records to return. Without specifying limit you will receive 5 results. The maximum limit is 1000.
parameters.name: limit

200.description: An array of Steam app IDs of all games that the companies have published.

get.description: This endpoint returns the list of Steam app IDs of all games that publisher companies have developed. Unlike the endpoint retrieving the Steam app IDs of a single publisher company, this one returns the list of games for multiple publishers.
get.summary: Get the list of Steam app IDs of all games that the companies have published.

parameters.description: (Optional) The number of records to skip for pagination
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: (Optional) The maximum number of records to return. Without specifying limit you will receive 5 results. The maximum limit is 1000.
parameters.name: limit

get.description: This endpoint returns the overview of a games publisher. The overview contains the company ID, name, information about the published games and publisher revenue insights.
get.summary: Overview of a games publisher.

parameters.description: The company ID of the publisher. This is an internal VGI's ID for the publisher. If the ID matches with a developer, then this means that it is the same company.
parameters.name: companyId

get.description: This endpoint returns the list of Steam app IDs of all games that the company/publisher has published.
get.summary: Get the list of Steam app IDs of all games that the company has published.

parameters.description: The company ID of the publisher. This is an internal VGI's ID for the publisher. If the ID matches with a developer, then this means that it is the same company.
parameters.name: companyId

get.description: This endpoint returns an overview of the Steam market size, sales, new game releases and user engagement metrics.
get.summary: Steam Market Data

get.description:
Retrieves the changes in reviews of Steam games. The reviews are returned as an array of objects, each object representing the change in reviews of a game on the given day. Only games with a change in reviews on the given day are included.

Use the date parameter to select the date by which the review changes of games are selected. The date must be in the format YYYY-MM-DD. The earliest date available is 2014-01-01. You can use the offset and limit parameters to paginate through the results. The limit parameter must be between 1 and 1000. The total number of results of the given day is returned in the X-Total-Count header. You can optionally use the steamAppIds parameter to retrieve the change in reviews of specific games on the given day.
get.summary: Get all changes in review counts of Steam games on a given day.

parameters.description: Date by which results are selected. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Earliest value: 2014-01-01.
parameters.name: date

parameters.description: How many results you will skip over. Default is 0.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Limits how many results you will get back. Default is 5.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Comma separated list of Steam app IDs.
parameters.name: steamAppIds

get.description: Retrieves the changes in reviews of a single Steam game. The reviews are returned as an array of objects, each object representing the change in reviews of a game over time. Only days with a change in reviews are included.
get.summary: Get all daily review count changes of a single Steam game.

200.description: An array of objects containing the Steam app ID of the game, the average playtime, the rank of the game by average playtime, the percentage of players who played the game, the median playtime and paytime range of the players.

get.description:
This endpoint returns the playtimes of Steam games.
The playtimes are returned as an object containing the average playtime, the rank of the game by average playtime, the percentage of players who played the game, the median playtime and paytime range of the players.
get.summary: Get playtimes of a Steam game

parameters.description: (Optional) The number of records to skip for pagination
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: (Optional) The maximum number of records to return. Without specifying limit you will receive 5 results. The maximum limit is 1000.
parameters.name: limit

get.description:
This endpoint returns the playtimes of a Steam game.
The playtimes are returned as an object containing the average playtime, the rank of the game by average playtime, the percentage of players who played the game, the median playtime and paytime range of the players.
get.summary: Get playtimes of a Steam game

200.description: An array of objects containing the Steam app ID of the game and the top countries for each game

get.description:
This endpoint returns the top countries of Steam games.
The list contains the country's code, name, the percentage of players from that country and the rank of the country by the number of players.
get.summary: Top 20 countries of a Steam game

parameters.description: (Optional) The number of records to skip for pagination
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: (Optional) The maximum number of records to return. Without specifying limit you will receive 5 results. The maximum limit is 1000.
parameters.name: limit

get.description:
This endpoint returns the top countries of a Steam game.
The list contains the country's code, name, the percentage of players from that country and the rank of the country by the number of players.
get.summary: Top 20 countries of a Steam game

200.description: An array of objects containing the Steam app ID of the game and the regions for each game

get.description:
This endpoint returns the list of regions for Steam games.
The list contains percentage of players in each region, region's name and the rank of the region by the number of players.
get.summary: Top Regions of Steam games

parameters.description: (Optional) The number of records to skip for pagination
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: (Optional) The maximum number of records to return. Without specifying limit you will receive 5 results. The maximum limit is 1000.
parameters.name: limit

get.description:
This endpoint returns the list of regions of a Steam game.
The list contains percentage of players in each region, region's name and the rank of the region by the number of players.
get.summary: Regions of a Steam game

200.description: An array of objects containing the Steam app ID of the main game and the player overlap data

get.description:
This endpoint returns the player overlap data for multiple Steam games. The data includes various overlap metrics such as LTD units sold overlap, MAU overlap, and wishlist overlap.

Note: we are using terms main game and reference game in the documentation here. The main game is the game for which we are fetching the overlap data, and the reference game is the game with which we are comparing the main game. So, the playerOverlaps array is a list of reference games.
get.summary: Get player overlap data for Steam game

parameters.description: (Optional) The number of records to skip for pagination
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: (Optional) The maximum number of records to return. Without specifying limit you will receive 1 result. The maximum is 3.
parameters.name: limit

200.description: An object containing the Steam app ID of the main game and the player overlap data

get.description:
This endpoint returns the player overlap data for a given Steam game. The data includes various overlap metrics such as LTD units sold overlap, MAU overlap, and wishlist overlap.

Note: we are using terms main game and reference game in the documentation here. The main game is the game for which we are fetching the overlap data, and the reference game is the game with which we are comparing the main game. So, the playerOverlaps array is a list of reference games.
get.summary: Get player overlap data for a Steam game

parameters.description: The Steam app ID of the main game
parameters.name: steamAppId

parameters.description: (Optional) The number of records to skip for pagination
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: (Optional) The maximum number of records to return. Without specifying limit you will receive 1 result.
parameters.name: limit

get.description:
This endpoint returns the list of countries with wishlists percentage based on steam id.
The response contains steamAppId and a list of percentage of wishlists in each country.
get.summary: Wishlists by Countries of steam game

200.description: An array of objects containing the Steam app ID of the main game and the wishlists by country

get.description: This endpoint returns the list of steam app ids and wishlist split by countries
get.summary: Wishlists by Country split of steam games

parameters.description: (Optional) The number of records to skip for pagination
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: (Optional) The maximum number of records to return. Without specifying a limit, you will receive 1 result. The maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: limit

200.description: An array of game objects containing the Steam app ID of the game and other metadata such as name, release date, developer, publisher, genres, tags, and more.

get.description: This endpoint returns the metadata of multiple Steam games. The metadata contains information about the games' name, release date, developer, publisher, and more.
get.summary: Metadata of Steam games

parameters.description: (Optional) The number of records to skip for pagination
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: (Optional) The maximum number of records to return. Without specifying limit you will receive 5 results. The maximum limit is 1000.
parameters.name: limit

get.description: This endpoint returns the metadata of a Steam game. The metadata contains information about the game's name, release date, developer, publisher, genres, tags, and more.
get.summary: Metadata of a Steam game

get.description:
This endpoint returns the outstanding wishlist count history of a single Steam game since 2024-03-06.
dateDate when the value was recorded
wishlistCountOutstanding wishlist count on the given date
get.summary: Get daily outstanding wishlist count of a Steam game.

get.description:
This endpoint returns the daily outstanding wishlist counts of Steam games on the given day.

Use steamAppIds to retrieve up to 1000 results at once. Alternatively, use pagination to retrieve up to 1000 results per request. The total number of results of the given day is returned in the X-Total-Count header.
get.summary: Get all outstanding wishlist counts of Steam games on a given day.

parameters.description: Date by which results are selected. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Earliest value: 2014-03-06.
parameters.name: date

parameters.description: How many results you will skip over. Minimum is 0.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Limits how many results you will get back. Minimum is 1. Maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: IDs by which results are selected. Comma separated list of Steam app IDs. Minimum ID count is 1. Maximum ID count is 1000.
parameters.name: steamAppIds

get.description:
This endpoint returns the follower count history of a single Steam game since 2021-05-21.
dateDate when the value was recorded
followerFollower count on the given date
get.summary: Get daily follower count of a Steam game.

get.description:
This endpoint returns the daily follower counts of Steam games on the given day.

Use steamAppIds to retrieve up to 1000 results at once. Alternatively, use pagination to retrieve up to 1000 results per request. The total number of results of the given day is returned in the X-Total-Count header.
get.summary: Get all follower counts of Steam games on a given day.

parameters.description: Date by which results are selected. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Earliest value: 2014-03-06.
parameters.name: date

parameters.description: How many results you will skip over. Minimum is 0.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Limits how many results you will get back. Minimum is 1. Maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: IDs by which results are selected. Comma separated list of Steam app IDs. Minimum ID count is 1. Maximum ID count is 1000.
parameters.name: steamAppIds

get.description:
This endpoint returns the concurrent player history of a single Steam game since 2021-05-21. Max/peak concurrent player count starts from 2014-01-01.
dateDate when the values were recorded
avgAverage player count on the given date
medianMedian player count on the given date
maxHighest (peak) recorded player count on the given date
minLowest recorded player count on the given date
get.summary: Get daily concurrent player history of a Steam game.

get.description:
This endpoint returns the concurrent player counts of one or more Steam games on the given day. Max/peak concurrent player count starts from 2014-01-01 and the rest of the values start from 2021-05-21.

Use steamAppIds to retrieve up to 1000 results at once. Alternatively, use pagination to retrieve up to 1000 results per request. The total number of results of the given day is returned in the X-Total-Count header.
get.summary: Get all concurrent player counts of Steam games on a given day.

parameters.description: Date by which player counts of games are selected. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Earliest value: 2014-01-01.
parameters.name: date

parameters.description: How many results you will skip over. Minimum is 0.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Limits how many results you will get back. Minimum is 1. Maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: IDs by which player counts are selected. Comma separated list of Steam app IDs. Minimum is 1. Maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: steamAppIds

get.description:
This endpoint returns the daily DAU and MAU counts of a single Steam game. DAU starts from 2024-03-18 and MAU starts from 2024-03-23.
dateDate when the value was recorded
dauNumber of daily active users
mauNumber of monthly active users
get.summary: Get daily DAU and MAU counts of a Steam game.

get.description:
This endpoint returns the DAU and MAU count of one or more Steam games on the given day. DAU starts from 2024-03-18 and MAU starts from 2024-03-23. Use pagination to retrieve up to 1000 results per request. The total number of results of the given day is returned in the X-Total-Count header.
steamAppIdSteam app ID of the game
dateDate when the value was recorded
dauNumber of daily active users
mauNumber of monthly active users
get.summary: Get DAU and MAU count of Steam games on a given day.

parameters.description: Date by which player counts of games are selected. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Earliest value: 2014-01-01.
parameters.name: date

parameters.description: How many results you will skip over. Minimum is 0.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Limits how many results you will get back. Minimum is 1. Maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: limit

get.description:
Retrieves the units sold increases of Steam games. The results are returned as an array of objects, each object representing the units sold increase of a game on the given day. Only games with an increase in units sold on the given day are included.

Use the date parameter to select the date by which the results are selected. The date must be in the format YYYY-MM-DD. The earliest date available is 2014-01-01. You can use the offset and limit parameters to paginate through the results. The limit parameter must be between 1 and 1000. The total number of results of the given day is returned in the X-Total-Count header. You can optionally use the steamAppIds parameter to retrieve the results of specific games on the given day.
get.summary: Get all units sold increases of Steam games on a given day.

parameters.description: Date by which results are selected. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Earliest value: 2014-01-01.
parameters.name: date

parameters.description: How many results you will skip over. Default is 0.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Limits how many results you will get back. Default is 5.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Comma separated list of Steam app IDs.
parameters.name: steamAppIds

get.description: Retrieves the increases in units sold of a single Steam game. The results are returned as an array of objects, each object representing the increase in units sold of a game on the given day. Only games with an increase in units sold on the given day are included.
get.summary: Get all daily increases in units sold of a single Steam game.

get.description:
Retrieves the revenue increases of one or more Steam games. The results are returned as an array of objects, each object representing the revenue increase of a game on the given day. Only games with an increase in revenue on the given day are included.

Use the date parameter to select the date by which the results are selected. The date must be in the format YYYY-MM-DD. The earliest date available is 2014-01-01. You can use the offset and limit parameters to paginate through the results. The limit parameter must be between 1 and 1000. The total number of results of the given day is returned in the X-Total-Count header. You can optionally use the steamAppIds parameter to retrieve the results of specific games on the given day.
get.summary: Get all revenue increases of Steam games on a given day.

parameters.description: Date by which results are selected. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Earliest value: 2014-01-01.
parameters.name: date

parameters.description: How many results you will skip over. Default is 0.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Limits how many results you will get back. Default is 5.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Comma separated list of Steam app IDs.
parameters.name: steamAppIds

get.description: Retrieves the revenue increases of a single Steam game. The results are returned as an array of objects, each object representing the increase in revenue of a game on the given day. Only games with an increase in revenue on the given day are included.
get.summary: Get all daily revenue increases of a single Steam game.

get.description: This endpoint returns price changes of a Steam game in a selected currency. USD history goes back to end of 2014, other currencies start at 2022-04-14.
get.summary: Get all price changes of a Steam game in a selected currency.

get.description: This endpoint returns price changes of a Steam game. USD history goes back to end of 2014, other currencies start at 2022-04-14.
get.summary: Get all price changes of a Steam game in all currencies.

get.description:
All-in-one endpoint that retrieves the historical data of Steam games. The data is returned as an array of objects, each object representing the historical values of a game on the given day. This endpoint returns all dates for all games since their release date, but no earlier than 2014-01-01.

Use the date parameter to select the date by which the results are selected. The date must be in the format YYYY-MM-DD. The earliest date available is 2014-01-01. You can use the offset and limit parameters to paginate through the results. The limit parameter must be between 1 and 1000. The total number of results of the given day is returned in the X-Total-Count header. You can optionally use the steamAppIds parameter to retrieve the results of specific games on the given day.
get.summary: Get all historical data of Steam games on a given day.

parameters.description: Date by which historical data is selected. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Earliest value: 2014-01-01.
parameters.name: date

parameters.description: How many results you will skip over. Default is 0.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Limits how many results you will get back. Default is 5.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Comma separated list of Steam app IDs.
parameters.name: steamAppIds

get.description: All-in-one endpoint that retrieves the historical data of a single Steam game. The data is returned as an array of objects, each object representing the historical values of a game on the given day. This endpoint returns all dates for the game since its release date, but no earlier than 2014-01-01.
get.summary: Get the whole historical data of a single Steam game since the release date, but no earlier than 2014-01-01.
